ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] re: Fascinating article
ygData.msgSnippet: That kinda makes sense. Bards don t easily translate into power, masculinity, etc. And they are a little more cerebral than most classes. Tzeetch ...
ygData.messageBody:
That kinda makes sense. Bards don't easily translate into power, masculinity, etc. And they are a
little more cerebral than most classes.

Tzeetch

--- "Cranfill, Wendy" <Wendy_Cranfill@...> wrote:

<HR>
<html><body>


<tt>
On another note, a year or two back, we did a little survey to find out how<BR>
old people on this mailing list were and it turned out that we have a more<BR>
"mature" group than would be indicated by general game demographics.<BR>
<BR>
-----Original Message-----<BR>
From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@...]<BR>
Sent: Friday, February 15, 2002 8:16 AM<BR>
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com<BR>
Subject: Re: [eqbards] re: Fascinating article<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
LOL -- I am a 42 year old father of four.  My wife and I group after the<BR>
kids go to bed and we fight evil mushrooms in Luclin P<BR>
<BR>
Been fantasy gaming for years and would have bought EQ even if the box had<BR>
no cover-art.<BR>
<BR>
EQmagickplayer@... wrote: <BR>
<BR>
Great! I am a 44 year old mother of 2 teenagers - single - well-rounded<BR>
(figure wise) - semi-computer literate.<BR>
<BR>
Why was I drawn to EQ? Let's see the unconscious desire to be Firiona Vie?<BR>
To seduce young male wood elves & enslave them as my personal sex slaves?<BR>
<BR>
Yeah, right. Obviously it is the author of this article that has some<BR>
suppressed sexual/masculine issues that need to be addressed.<BR>
<BR>
Jovvi Songangel - 21 Half elf Bard - Drinal<BR>
Charai Bandroichta - 26 Halfling Druid - Drinal<BR>
-- <BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
